result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendy M. Izzo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wendy M. Izzo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Wendy M. Izzo was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer to Florida. Defendant is entitled to 6 days credit for time served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED TO COSTS, REMAINDER RETURNED TO SURETY.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No intoxicants. Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Do not enter establishment where primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

Complete compas assessment, counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup especially Cognitive Therapy, Criminal Thinking, Psychological, & Domestic Abuse.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
